New Records: Freddie Freeman became the first player to homer in the first four games of a World Series and his streak of long balls in six consecutive games is one more than Houston’s George Springer in 2017 and ‘19.
Anthony Volpe became the first player in Series history with a grand slam and a pair of stolen bases in one game.
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hit a grand slam home run during the third inning.
Freddie Freeman hit a home run in the first inning.
Wells and Gleyber Torres added homers for the Yankees.
Will Smith hit a homer in the fifth inning.
Freddie Freeman avoided an inning-ending double play after a video review.
Wells hit a second-deck homer in the sixth inning.
Torres hit a three-run homer in the eighth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed excitement about the atmosphere in Yankee Stadium after Volpe's grand slam.
Austin Wells described the mood as relieved and fun after the dire situation following Monday’s loss.
Freddie Freeman reflected on his home run streak and expressed hope to continue it.
Anthony Volpe shared his dream of winning the World Series and acknowledged the work still needed.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees avoided their first losing Series sweep since 1976.
The Yankees stopped a seven-game Series losing streak against the Dodgers dating to 1981.
The Yankees got their first seven RBIs from the bottom three hitters in their batting order.
